GestureCard.description: A card representing a gesture. Minimalist, dark surface, shows video preview on hover.
GestureCard.specs: bg-surface border border-white/5 hover:border-primary/50 transition-all duration-300 hover:shadow-lg hover:shadow-primary/20 rounded-xl overflow-hidden group relative
GestureCard.interactions: Scale up slightly on hover. Video preview plays on hover.

EnrollmentFlow.description: Face ID style enrollment modal. Circular progress ring, camera feed overlay.
EnrollmentFlow.specs: Fixed overlay, glassmorphism background. Central circular camera feed with SVG progress ring.
EnrollmentFlow.animation: Pulse on success, Shake on failure. Progress ring fills smoothly.

CameraFeed.description: Real-time camera preview with HUD overlay.
CameraFeed.specs: Relative container, rounded-lg overflow-hidden. Overlay includes corner brackets and scanning line.
CameraFeed.overlay: Absolute positioning, z-10. Green/Purple scanning line animation.

Sidebar.specs: Fixed left, h-screen, glassmorphism (bg-black/40 backdrop-blur-xl), border-r border-white/10. Flex column layout.

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. SETUP: Install 'framer-motion' and 'recharts' immediately. These are critical for the requested animations and charts.
2. THEME: Enforce Dark Mode by default. Add 'dark' class to the html or body tag. Use the provided color palette variables in index.css.
3. LAYOUT: Create a Layout component that includes the Sidebar and a main content area. All pages should be wrapped in this.
4. DASHBOARD: Build the 'Overview' page using a Bento Grid layout. Use the 'abstract_purple' image as a subtle background for the 'Model Status' card.
5. GESTURES: Create a 'GestureLibrary' page. Use the 'GestureCard' component to display static and movement gestures. Use the provided gesture images as thumbnails.
6. ENROLLMENT: Build the 'AddGesture' flow as a multi-step modal. Step 1: Instructions. Step 2: Camera Preview with 'Face ID' style scanning ring (use Framer Motion). Step 3: Success.
7. MOCK DATA: Create a 'mockData.js' file to simulate the backend (gestures list, system status, recent logs). Do not leave empty states.
8. POLISH: Add 'framer-motion' layout transitions between pages. Use 'AnimatePresence' for smooth mounting/unmounting.
9. ACCESSIBILITY: Ensure all interactive elements have aria-labels and focus states (ring-2 ring-primary).
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: You tend to converge toward generic, 'on distribution' outputs. In frontend design, this creates what users call the 'AI slop' aesthetic. Avoid this: make creative, distinctive frontends that surprise and delight.
Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: 'transition: all'. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add '.App { text-align: center; }' in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
